```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
#
```

## Define Data

```{r data}
x <- 1:10
y <- c(2, 4, 5, 8, 9, 11, 13, 14, 18, 20)
categories <- c("A", "B", "C", "D")
values <- c(25, 40, 15, 30)
```

## 1. Scatter Plot

```{r scatter-plot}
plot(x, y,
     main = "Scatter Plot",
     xlab = "X values",
     ylab = "Y values",
     col = "blue",
     pch = 19)
```

## 2. Line Plot

```{r line-plot}
plot(x, y,
     type = "l",
     main = "Line Plot",
     xlab = "X",
     ylab = "Y",
     col = "red",
     lwd = 2)
```

## 3. Bar Plot

```{r bar-plot}
barplot(values,
        names.arg = categories,
        main = "Bar Plot",
        col = c("coral", "steelblue", "seagreen", "gold"))
```

## 4. Histogram

```{r histogram}
data <- rnorm(100, mean = 50, sd = 10)
hist(data,
     main = "Histogram",
     xlab = "Value",
     col = "lightblue",
     breaks = 10)
```

## 2x2 Plot Layout

```{r multi-plot, fig.width=10, fig.height=10}
par(mfrow = c(2, 2))

# Scatter plot
plot(x, y,
     main = "Scatter Plot",
     xlab = "X values",
     ylab = "Y values",
     col = "blue",
     pch = 19)

# Line plot
plot(x, y,
     type = "l",
     main = "Line Plot",
     xlab = "X",
     ylab = "Y",
     col = "red",
     lwd = 2)

# Bar plot
barplot(values,
        names.arg = categories,
        main = "Bar Plot",
        col = c("coral", "steelblue", "seagreen", "gold"))

# Histogram
hist(data,
     main = "Histogram",
     xlab = "Value",
     col = "lightblue",
     breaks = 10)

par(mfrow = c(1, 1))
```
